frame.name: Concessive
frame.definition:
<def-root>A speaker marks a <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen> as being or implying a contradiction to the <fen>Main_assertion</fen>. Some LUs specify the <fen>Main_assertion</fen>, others the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen>, as referring to the preceding discourse (i.e. DNI), while yet others are conjunctions joining the two.
<ex><t>Although</t> <fex name="Conceded_state_of_affairs">she had some trouble</fex> , <fex name="Main_assertion">she was able to finish about two hours early</fex> .</ex> <ex><t>Nevertheless</t> , <fex name="Main_assertion">we did win</fex> . <fex name="Conceded_state_of_affairs">DNI</fex> </ex> <ex><fex name="Main_assertion">I wanted to come</fex> , <t>but</t> <fex name="Conceded_state_of_affairs">I did n't remember where the party was</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Conceded_state_of_affairs
FE.definition: <def-root>A proposition or set of propositions that the speaker wants the addressee to believe or take for granted. This statement is not asserted, but presupposed by the speaker of the sentence, and is mentioned to contrast with the <fen>Main_assertion</fen>. It would or could seem to predict a situation different than the <fen>Main_assertion</fen>, but, for reasons left implicit, this normal prediction is contradicted by the fact that the <fen>Main_assertion</fen> and the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen> are both simultaneously true. </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity which metonymically stands in for an associated <fen>Statement</fen>.
<ex>She got married <t>in spite of</t> <fex name="Top">him</fex> .</ex> <ex><t>Despite</t> <fex name="Topic">her</fex> , they finished on time .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Main_assertion
FE.definition: <def-root>The statement that the speaker wishes to assert or offer as their main contribution to the discourse, which is be modified or hedged in some way by the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen>. The force of the contribution of the <fen>Main_assertion</fen> is presented as undiluted by the fact that something different from the <fen>Main_assertion</fen> would normally by predicted, based on the facts in the <fen>Conceded_state_of_affairs</fen>. </def-root>
